thread.title: Report: Trump considering Marlins owner Jeffrey Loria for ambassador to France
thread.title_full: Report: Trump considering Marlins owner Jeffrey Loria for ambassador to France

author: USA TODAY
title: Report: Trump considering Marlins owner Jeffrey Loria for ambassador to France
text:
Report: Trump considering Marlins owner Jeffrey Loria for ambassador to France Loria is reportedly in talks to sell the team. Post to Facebook Report: Trump considering Marlins owner Jeffrey Loria for ambassador to France Loria is reportedly in talks to sell the team.  //usat.ly/2lQIZZc   Report: Trump considering Marlins owner Jeffrey Loria for ambassador to France Mike Coppinger , USA TODAY Published 7:48 p.m. ET Feb. 15, 2017 | Updated 10 minutes ago Jeffrey Loria is expected to sell the Miami Marlins soon. (Photo: Steve Mitchell, USA TODAY Sports) 12 CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Miami Marlins owner Jeffrey Loria reportedly could sell the team, and if he does, it looks like he won't be bored without his baseball club. 
The New York Post reported Wednesday that the 76-year-old art dealer is under consideration for a role in the Trump administration as U.S. ambassador to France. White House chief of staff Reince Priebus is lobbying for Loria to land the post, per the report. 
Loria has been linked to President Donald Trump in another way recently. Marlins mum on potential sale, but suitors lurk - including Trump connection 
The New York Times reported last week that Loria is in talks to sell the baseball club to a group that includes Joshua Kushner, the brother of Jared Kushner. Jared, of course, is married to Ivanka Trump and also serves as the President's top adviser. 
But that's not all. 
Loria, along with his wife, Julie, donated $250,000 to the Trump PAC during the campaign.
